title: How to Make Crumpets

steps.headline: Whisk the flours and yeast.
steps.description: Get out a mixing bowl and put 1 1/3 cups (175 g) of bread (strong white) flour and 1 2/5 cups (175 g) of all-purpose (plain) flour into it. Whisk in 2 1/4-ounce (7 g) packets of instant yeast for about 30 seconds.Did You Know? Using a mix of bread and all-purpose flours will create tender crumpets that have slightly chewy centers.

steps.headline: Dissolve the sugar in the warm milk in a separate bowl.
steps.description: Pour 1 ⁄2 cups (350 ml) of warm milk into a small measuring bowl or jug. Stir in 1 teaspoon (4 g) of granulated sugar until the sugar dissolves. For the richest tasting crumpets, use whole milk.

steps.headline: Stir the milk into the flour.
steps.description: Use a wooden spoon to stir the dry ingredients while you slowly pour the warm milk into the bowl. Keep stirring until the flour is incorporated and the batter is smooth. It should take 3 to 4 minutes to mix the thick, stretchy batter.

steps.headline: Cover and prove the batter for 20 to 60 minutes.
steps.description: Tear off a piece of plastic wrap and cover the bowl tightly. Leave the batter to rest at room temperature until it doubles in size and begins to sink back down. The batter should be covered with tiny bubbles once it's finished proving.

steps.headline: Stir baking soda and salt into the water.
steps.description: Get out a small bowl and pour 1 cup (240 ml) of warm water into it. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon (2 g) of baking soda and 1 teaspoon (5.5 g) of salt until they dissolve.Did You Know? The baking soda will help the crumpets develop their signature holey texture.

steps.headline: Beat the water mixture into the batter.
steps.description: Unwrap the bowl of batter and pour about ⁄4 cup (180 ml) of the water mixture into it. Use the wooden spoon to beat the batter until the liquid is absorbed. At this point, the batter will still be thick and stretchy, but thin enough to pour.

steps.headline: Cover and rest the batter for 20 minutes.
steps.description: Cover the bowl with the plastic wrap and leave the batter at room temperature. This will relax the dough so the texture of the crumpets is tender.

steps.headline: Heat a griddle over medium and grease it.
steps.description: Place a flat griddle or large skillet on the stove and turn the burner to medium. Drizzle a little sunflower or vegetable oil on the griddle. It's important to use medium heat so the crumpets don't cook too quickly when you pour them in the rings.

steps.headline: Grease 4 crumpet rings and place them on the griddle.
steps.description: While the griddle heats, rub a little butter or oil on the inside of 4 crumpet rings. Put the rings on the griddle. You should be able to fit all 4. If not, put as many rings on the griddle as you can.Tip: If you don't have crumpet rings, use large cookie cutters, metal tart rings, egg rings, or cleaned tuna cans. Greasing the rings will make it easier to remove the crumpets once they've finished cooking.

steps.headline: Fill each crumpet ring 1/2 full and cook them for 4 to 5 minutes.
steps.description: Use a ladle or spoon to scoop the crumpet batter into each ring. Leave the crumpets to cook without turning or moving the rings. You should see bubbles form across the tops and the crumpets will look dry. If you fill the crumpet rings more than 1/2 full, they'll be too thick to bake properly.

steps.headline: Flip the crumpets cook them for 3 minutes.
steps.description: Use tongs to carefully flip each crumpet over. If you can, lift away the rings and set them aside to cool a little. Let the crumpets finish cooking on the other side so they turn golden brown. Transfer the cooked crumpets to a wire rack and cook the remaining batter in batches. Remember to grease the rings before cooking another batch of crumpets. If you like an extra-crisp crumpet, place the crumpets on a sheet and hold them under the broiler for 1 minute.

steps.headline: Serve the hot crumpets.
steps.description:
Crumpets are best while they're still hot and fresh from the griddle. For a simple treat, brush the crumpets with lots of butter or set out any of these toppings:
Jam, jelly, marmalade
Cheese
Nut butter
Honey, maple syrup, golden syrup
